intro: Acrodiclidium anacardioides, commonly known as the African sumach, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a three-lobed drupe, often containing a single seed. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
